info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:58AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong rainshowers will impact portions of central Delta, northwestern Mesa, southwestern Garfield and southwestern Rio Blanco Counties through 1230 PM MDT... At 1157 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong rainshowers along a line extending from 28 miles northwest of Fruita to 20 miles south of Grand Junction. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of central Delta, northwestern Mesa, southwestern Garfield and southwestern Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Mesa, Cameo, Fruitvale, Molina, Clifton, Whitewater, Glade Park, Redlands, Skyway and Plateau City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 7 and 72. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 58. Colorado 65 between mile markers 11 and 61. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 50. Colorado 141 between mile markers 136 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
